comments:
AdapterFactoryEditingDomain.isReadOnly() returns false for many resources that we have no way of writing to.

For instance, create a model that references objects in an "external" resource (one with a "platform:/plugin/..." URI), and try saving it. Now that the generated editor attempts to save all non-read-only resources in the set, it will try to save the external resource and throw an exception like this:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.uml2.uml.editor 2 0 2006-01-27 11:07:02.849
!MESSAGE protocol doesn't support output
!STACK 0
java.net.UnknownServiceException: protocol doesn't support output
	at java.net.URLConnection.getOutputStream(URLConnection.java:785)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.URIConverterImpl.createURLOutputStream(URIConverterImpl.java:390)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.URIConverterImpl.createOutputStream(URIConverterImpl.java:310)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.ResourceImpl.save(ResourceImpl.java:847)
	at org.eclipse.uml2.uml.editor.presentation.UMLEditor$19.execute(UMLEditor.java:1284)
	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.WorkspaceModifyOperation$1.run(WorkspaceModifyOperation.java:100)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1714)
	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.WorkspaceModifyOperation.run(WorkspaceModifyOperation.java:112)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)

AdapterFactoryEditingDomain.isReadOnly() should only return false for URI forms that it knows can be saved, namely "file:...", "platform:/resource/...", and archive URIs where the archive file is one of the above.

The fix is in CVS: isReadOnly() now calls a new protected method, isReadOnlyURI(), and always returns true if it does.  This new method returns false for the above types of URIs and true for all others, and can be overridden to change this behaviour.
